item.title: Nats add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Men occasionally stumble over the truth, but most of them pick themselves up and hurry off as if nothing ever happened." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Nats add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "Reality is that which, when you stop believing in it, doesn't go away." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Nats add a quote by Vladimir Nabokov
item.description: "Let all of life be an unfettered howl. Like the crowd greeting the gladiator. Don't stop to think, don't interrupt the scream, exhale, release life's rapture." -- Vladimir Nabokov

item.title: Nats add a quote by Jerome K. Jerome
item.description: "Idleness, like kisses, to be sweet must be stolen." -- Jerome K. Jerome

item.title: Nats add a quote by J.M. Barrie
item.description: "I'm not young enough to know everything." -- J.M. Barrie

item.title: Nats add a quote by Marcus Aurelius
item.description: "Dwell on the beauty of life. Watch the stars, and see yourself running with them." -- Marcus Aurelius

item.title: Nats add a quote by Marcus Aurelius
item.description: "The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts." -- Marcus Aurelius

item.title: Nats add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "Live a good life. If there are gods and they are just, then they will not care how devout you have been, but will welcome you based on the virtues you have lived by. If there are gods, but unjust, then you should not want to worship them. If there are no gods, then you will be gone, but will have lived a noble life that will live on in the memories of your loved ones." -- Anonymous

item.title: Nats add a quote by Marcus Aurelius
item.description: "When you arise in the morning think of what a privilege it is to be alive, to think, to enjoy, to love ..." -- Marcus Aurelius

item.title: Nats add a quote by Jonah Lehrer
item.description: "The great ages did not perhaps produce much more talent than ours,' [T.S.] Eliot wrote. 'But less talent was wasted." -- Jonah Lehrer

item.title: Nats add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Make the most of yourself....for that is all there is of you." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Nats add a quote by Anne Frank
item.description: "How noble and good everyone could be if, every evening before falling asleep, they were to recall to their minds the events of the whole day and consider exactly what has been good and bad. Then without realizing it, you try to improve yourself at the start of each new day." -- Anne Frank

item.title: Nats add a quote by Jim Rohn
item.description: "Motivation is what gets you started. Habit is what keeps you going." -- Jim Rohn

item.title: Nats add a quote by Stephen Richards
item.description: "Minds are like flowers, they only open when the time is right." -- Stephen Richards

item.title: Nats add a quote by John Dryden
item.description: "We first make our habits, then our habits make us." -- John Dryden

item.title: Nats add a quote by Michael Jordan
item.description: "Everybody has talent, but ability takes hard work." -- Michael Jordan

item.title: Nats add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Nats add a quote by Bill Hicks
item.description: "Watching television is like taking black spray paint to your third eye." -- Bill Hicks

item.title: Nats add a quote by J.M. Barrie
item.description: "One girl is worth more use than 20 boys." -- J.M. Barrie

item.title: Nats add a quote by John Wilmot
item.description: "Before I got married I had six theories about raising children; now, I have six children and no theories." -- John Wilmot

item.title: Nats add a quote by Dante Alighieri
item.description: "Do not be afraid; our fate Cannot be taken from us; it is a gift." -- Dante Alighieri

item.title: Nats add a quote by Dante Alighieri
item.description: "There is no greater sorrow Than to recall a happy time When miserable." -- Dante Alighieri

item.title: Nats add a quote by Umberto Eco
item.description: "We live for books." -- Umberto Eco

item.title: Nats add a quote by Anne Carson
item.description: "Madness and witchery as well as bestiality are conditions commonly associated with the use of the female voice in public." -- Anne Carson

item.title: Nats add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "By the pricking of my thumbs, Something wicked this way comes." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Nats add a quote by Moliere
item.description: "Trees that are slow to grow bear the best fruit." -- Moliere

item.title: Nats add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Be yourself; everyone else is already taken." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Nats add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Nats add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Nats add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein
